results.title: A Discussion of Fyodor Dostoyevsky's 'The Crocodile'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
Commentator Clifton Fadiman discusses various themes and ideas presented in the short story “The Crocodile” by Dostoyevsky, and he points out the significance of the themes in relation to the life of the author and certain events in Russian history.
results.description:

results.title: A Discussion of Frank Stockton's 'The Lady, or the tiger?'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A study of the classic short story by American writer, Frank R. Stockton. Uses “historical” footage interspersed with dramatic narrative finishing with taunting question of suitor’s choice of doom - the tiger or the lady.

results.title: A Discussion in history
results.brief_description: Illustrates the technique of discussion as a method of teaching at senior high school level, and shows how a well-planned discussion may yield a deeper and clearer understanding of ideas. The subject of the french Revolution is introduced by the lecturer, who then leads the group in an unrehearsed discussion on various aspects of the subject.

results.title: A discovery of freedom
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. This story is a document of 17 year-old Tom’s experiences in the Eureka 150 youth team. “..I realised that my freedoms and rights were things I had taken for granted”.

results.title: A Disastrous day
results.creator_credit: Abby Dietrich, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was a typical morning in Lennox Head for Abby Dietrich and her mother, when things changed dramatically. A tornado and intense storm were followed by calls from friends and family, and the community checking up on each other, helping out and cleaning up.

results.title: A Disappearing trick (K)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book ” A Bear called Paddington”. Paddington puts on a magic show for the Brown Family, Mr. Gruber and Mr. Curry. After repeatedly annoying Mr. Curry in the course of his demonstration of magic tricks, Paddington decides it is time to disappear.

results.title: A Disappearing trick
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book “A Bear called Paddington”. Paddington puts on a magic show for the Brown Family, Mr. Gruber and Mr. Curry. After repeatedly annoying Mr. Curry during the course of his demonstration of magic tricks, Paddington decides it is time to disappear. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: A Director talks about his film
results.creator_credit: David Grotenstein, Peter Riegert, Susan Krebs and Prospective Films
results.brief_description: A satirical film depicting an interview with an Italian film director, Aldo Altonandino who’s remarks in Italian are translated into English by a deadpanned, uninvolved female interpreter. As he gets carried away by his pseudo-eloquence the translator continues in robot-like fashion. As the camera pulls back, the real director appears explaining his idea for the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Grotenstein, Peter Riegert, Susan Krebs and Prospective Films
results.description: A satirical film depicting an interview with an Italian film director, Aldo Altonandino who’s remarks in Italian are translated into English by a deadpanned, uninvolved female interpreter. As he gets carried away by his pseudo-eloquence the translator continues in robot-like fashion. As the camera pulls back, the real director appears explaining his idea for the film.
description_for_label: A satirical film depicting an interview with an Italian film director, Aldo Altonandino who’s remarks in Italian are translated into English by a deadpanned, uninvolved female interpreter. As he gets carried away by his pseudo-eloquence the translator continues in robot-like fashion. As the camera pulls back, the real director appears explaining his idea for the film.

results.title: A Dignified exit
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines the moral and legal issues involved in the future publication of a manual describing ‘How to commit suicide effectively’ to be published by EXIT- The Society for the Right to Die with Dignity, and also hears the views of three women who have known great suffering through ill-health.
